alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 25 at 2:17PM AKDT until March 28 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with blizzard conditions. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range near Passes. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Blowing snow reducing visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. Snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions will deteriorate Sunday as falling snow adds to the blowing snow. The strongest winds and lowest visibility are expected Sunday, but winds and blowing snow will continue into Monday night.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
